sen.j: 葛城国造（かずらきのくにのみやつこ・かずらきこくぞう・かつらぎのくにのみやつこ・かつらぎこくぞう)は大和国南西部を支配した国造。
sen.e: Kazuraki no Kuni no Miyatsuko (葛城国造) was a Kuni no Miyatsuko (the head of a local government) who ruled over the southern-west of Yamato Province.

Kazuraki no Kuni no Miyatsuko (also called 'Kazuraki Kokuzo', 'Katsuragi no Kuni no Miyatsuko', or 'Katsuragi Kokuzo') was a Kuni no Miyatsuko (the head of a local government) who ruled over the southern-west of Yamato Province.
sen.cmt: (葛城国造)漢字表記を訳に残す必要はないので削除しました。名前の読みに一つしか訳出されていなかったので、(also called 'Kazuraki Kokuzo', 'Katsuragi no Kuni no Miyatsuko', or 'Katsuragi Kokuzo')と追加しました。
sen.e: Kazuraki no Kuni no Miyatsuko (also called 'Kazuraki Kokuzo', 'Katsuragi no Kuni no Miyatsuko', or 'Katsuragi Kokuzo') was a Kuni no Miyatsuko (the head of a local government) who ruled over the southern-west of Yamato Province.

sen.j: 葛木国造とも。
sen.e: Also written as 葛木国造.
Also written as "葛木国造".
sen.cmt: 漢字表記の箇所に" "を加えました。
sen.e: Also written as "葛木国造".

sen.j: 剣根。
sen.e: Tsurugine
Tsurugine
Tsurugine

sen.j: 高魂命の5世孫または天押立命の4世孫という。
sen.e: The fifth-generation grandson of Takami musubi no Mikoto or the fourth-generation grandson of Amekamitachi no Mikoto.
It is said that he was the fifth-generation grandson of Takami musubi no Mikoto or the fourth-generation grandson of Amekamitachi no Mikoto.
sen.cmt: It is said that he wasを追加しました。
sen.e: It is said that he was the fifth-generation grandson of Takami musubi no Mikoto or the fourth-generation grandson of Amekamitachi no Mikoto.

sen.j: 神武天皇2年に初めて葛城国造とされた。
sen.e: In the second year of the Emperor Jimu's reign, he was made Kazuraki no Kuni no Miyatsuko for the first time.
He became Kazuraki no Kuni no Miyatsuko for the first time in 658 B.C.
sen.cmt: was made→becameに変更しました。in the second year of the reign of Emperor Jinmuは誤訳です。神武天皇二年→in 658 B.C.
sen.e: He became Kazuraki no Kuni no Miyatsuko for the first time in 658 B.C.

sen.j: 初代倭国造とされる椎根津彦とともに国造の最も古い例とされる。
sen.e: He is regarded as one of the oldest Kuni no Miyatsuko along with the first Yamato no Kuni no Miyatsuko, namely Shiinetsuhiko.
He is regarded as one of the oldest Kuni no Miyatsuko along with Shiinetsuhiko, the first Yamato no Kuni no Miyatsuko.
He is regarded as one of the oldest Kuni no Miyatsuko along with Shiinetsuhiko, the first Yamato no Kuni no Miyatsuko.

sen.j: 葛城氏。
sen.e: The Katsuragi Clan.
The clan was Kazuraki.
sen.cmt: The Katsuragi Clan→The clan was Kazurakiに変更しました。「かつらぎ」という読みもありますが、上段セルからの流れから「かずらき」という読みが一番初めに出ているので整合性をとるためにもKazuragiに変更しました。以下のセルも同様です。確認お願いします。
sen.e: The clan was Kazuraki.

sen.j: 姓は直。
sen.e: His surname was Atai.
His surname was Atai.
His surname was Atai.

sen.j: 天武天皇12年(683年)に連に、14年に忌寸に昇格した。
sen.e: In 683, he was promoted to the rank of Muraji and in 685 was promoted to the rank of Imiki.
In 683, he was promoted to the rank of Muraji and was promoted to the rank of Imiki in 685.
In 683, he was promoted to the rank of Muraji and was promoted to the rank of Imiki in 685.

sen.j: 5世紀に繁栄した葛城氏は武内宿祢の子孫で、姓も臣で別系統だが、婚姻関係によって同系統化している。
sen.e: The Katsuragi Clan, who prospered in the fifth century, descended from Takeuchi no Sukune with the surname Omi and with a different lineage, but they were integrated into the same lineage by marriage.

The Kazuraki clan, who prospered in the fifth century, descended from Takeuchi no Sukune with the surname of Omi and with a different lineage, but they were integrated into the same lineage by marriage.
sen.cmt: Katsuragi Clan→Kazuraki clansurname Omi→surname of Omiに変更しました。
sen.e: The Kazuraki clan, who prospered in the fifth century, descended from Takeuchi no Sukune with the surname of Omi and with a different lineage, but they were integrated into the same lineage by marriage.

sen.j: 大和国葛城地方。
sen.e: Katsuragi Region of Yamato Province.
Kazuraki clan was located in Katsuragi Region of Yamato Province.
sen.cmt: Kazuraki clan was located in追加しました。
sen.e: Kazuraki clan was located in Katsuragi Region of Yamato Province.

sen.j: 葛上郡・葛下郡両郡。
sen.e: Both Katsujo and Katsuge Counties.
It was in both Katsujo County and Katsuge County.
sen.cmt: Both Katsujo and Katsuge Counties.→文章になるようにIt was in both Katsujo County and Katsuge County.に変更しました。
sen.e: It was in both Katsujo County and Katsuge County.

sen.j: 現在の奈良県御所市・五條市など。
sen.e: Present day Gose City and Gojo City, Nara Prefecture.
The current location is in Gose City and Gojo City areas, Nara Prefecture.
sen.cmt: Present dayを削除し、The current location isに変更しました。areasを追加しました。
sen.e: The current location is in Gose City and Gojo City areas, Nara Prefecture.

tit.e: The Ujigami (a guardian god or spirit of a particular place in the Shinto religion)
Ujigami (a guardian god or spirit of a particular place in the Shinto religion)
Ujigami (a guardian god or spirit of a particular place in the Shinto religion)

sen.j: 不明。
sen.e: Unknown.
It was unknown.
sen.cmt: It was を追加しました。
sen.e: It was unknown.

sen.j: 同地域には葛城御縣神社・葛城一言主神社など延喜の制の名神大社・大社が連立。
sen.e: In the same region, there were several grand shrines with famous gods in the Engi System such as Katsuragi Miagata-Jinja Shrine and Katsuragi Hitokotonushi-Jinja Shrine.
In the same region, there were several Grand shrines and Myojin-taisha shrines in the Engi System such as Katsuragi Miagata-Jinja Shrine and Katsuragi Hitokotonushi-Jinja Shrine.
sen.cmt: 名神大社・大社の訳漏れです。grand shrines with famous gods→Grand shrines and Myojin-taisha shrinesに変更しました。（名神大社・大社は神社の種類なのでshrineは小文字のままにしてあります。）asの後のスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: In the same region, there were several Grand shrines and Myojin-taisha shrines in the Engi System such as Katsuragi Miagata-Jinja Shrine and Katsuragi Hitokotonushi-Jinja Shrine.

sen.j: 葛城荒田彦 ...... 古墳時代の伝説上の人。
sen.e: Katsuragi no Aratahiko…a legendary person in the Kofun period.
Kazuraki no Aratahiko: He was a legendary person in the Kofun period.
sen.cmt: Katsuragi→Kazurakiに変更しています。…→: に変更しました。He wasを追加しました。
sen.e: Kazuraki no Aratahiko: He was a legendary person in the Kofun period.

sen.j: 国造。
sen.e: A Kuni no Miyatsuko.
He was the Kuni no Miyatsuko.
He was the Kuni no Miyatsuko.

sen.j: 娘の葛比売が神別葛城氏の襲津彦に嫁いだ。
sen.e: His daughter, Katsurahime, married Sotsuhiko of the shinbetsu Katsuragi clan.
His daughter, Katsurahime, married Sotsuhiko of the Shinbetsu Kazuraki clan.
sen.cmt: shinbetsuをShinbetsuに修正しました。Katsuragi→Kazurakiに変更しています。
sen.e: His daughter, Katsurahime, married Sotsuhiko of the Shinbetsu Kazuraki clan.

sen.j: 葛城磐村 ...... 古墳時代の人。
sen.e: Katsuragi no Iwamura…a person in the Kofun period.
Kazuraki no Iwamura: He was a person in the Kofun period.
sen.cmt: Katsuragi→Kazurakiに変更しています。…→: に変更しました。He wasを追加しました。
sen.e: Kazuraki no Iwamura: He was a person in the Kofun period.

sen.j: 娘の広子は用明天皇の嬪となった。
sen.e: His daughter, Hiroko, became a concubine to Emperor Yomei.
His daughter, Hiroko, became a concubine to Emperor Yomei.
His daughter, Hiroko, became a concubine to Emperor Yomei.
